question: Guidance
questionMeaning: Help that shows someone what to do.
answerMeaning: A suggestion about what someone should do
sentence: My teacher gave me good advice (/ədˈvaɪs/) on how to study for the test.

question: Data
questionMeaning: facts that can be used to understand something
answerMeaning: facts or details about something
sentence: I found information (/ˌɪnfəˈmeɪʃən/) about the museum online.

question: Lodging
questionMeaning: a place where someone can stay, like a hotel or a room
answerMeaning: a place to stay, like a hotel or room
sentence: The hotel provides comfortable accommodation (/əˌkɒməˈdeɪʃən/) for all its guests.

question: Improvement
questionMeaning: getting better
answerMeaning: moving forward or getting better
sentence: She is making progress (/ˈprəʊɡres/) in her studies.

question: Issue
questionMeaning: a matter needing attention
answerMeaning: a situation that causes difficulty
sentence: I have a problem (/ˈprɒbləm/) with my computer.

question: Companionship
questionMeaning: when you feel a sense of closeness being with another person
answerMeaning: a relationship between friends
sentence: Our friendship (/ˈfrendʃɪp/) is very special.

question: Present
questionMeaning: something given to someone
answerMeaning: something given to someone without payment
sentence: I bought a gift (/ɡɪft/) for my friend.

question: Thought
questionMeaning: an opinion produced by thinking, or occurring suddenly in the mind
answerMeaning: a thought or suggestion as to a possible course of action
sentence: That's a great idea (/aɪˈdɪə/) for a project!

question: Reality
questionMeaning: the state of things as they actually exist
answerMeaning: the real situation or fact
sentence: The actual (/ˈæktʃuəl/) is different from what I thought.

question: Scent
questionMeaning: a particular smell
answerMeaning: the sense that lets you notice odors
sentence: I love the smell (/smɛl/) of freshly baked bread.

question: Take
questionMeaning: to get or receive something
answerMeaning: to take something from someone with the intention of returning it
sentence: He wants to borrow (/ˈbɒrəʊ/) some money for lunch.

question: See
questionMeaning: to notice with your eyes
answerMeaning: to direct your eyes to see
sentence: Look (/lʊk/) at the dog! It is cute.

question: Lift
questionMeaning: to move something up
answerMeaning: to lift something to a higher position
sentence: Please raise (/reɪz/) your hand if you have a question.

question: Start
questionMeaning: to commence
answerMeaning: to start something
sentence: Let's begin (/bɪˈɡɪn/) the game now.

question: Shatter
questionMeaning: to break into pieces
answerMeaning: to separate into pieces or stop working
sentence: Be careful not to break (/breɪk/) the glass.

question: Slice
questionMeaning: to cut into thin pieces
answerMeaning: to use a sharp tool to divide something
sentence: I will cut (/kʌt/) the paper in half.

question: Stay
questionMeaning: to remain in a place
answerMeaning: to stay in one place until something happens
sentence: Please wait (/weɪt/) for me at the bus stop.

question: Say again
questionMeaning: to speak once more
answerMeaning: to say or do something again
sentence: I will repeat (/rɪˈpiːt/) the instructions so everyone understands.

question: Keep
questionMeaning: to hold onto something
answerMeaning: to keep something safe or store it for later use
sentence: I will save (/seɪv/) my money for a toy.

question: Mark
questionMeaning: to record points
answerMeaning: to get points in a game or test
sentence: I want to score (/skɔː/) a goal in soccer.

question: Uninterested
questionMeaning: not wanting to pay attention
answerMeaning: feeling tired of something because it's not interesting
sentence: I felt bored (/bɔːd/) during the long movie.

question: Caring
questionMeaning: showing concern for others
answerMeaning: showing kindness to someone
sentence: She is sympathetic (/ˌsɪmpəˈθɛtɪk/) to my problems.

question: Engaging
questionMeaning: attracting interest or attention
answerMeaning: something that catches your attention
sentence: The book is very interesting (/ˈɪntrəstɪŋ/).

question: Pretty
questionMeaning: attractive or nice to look at
answerMeaning: very pretty or attractive
sentence: The flowers are beautiful (/ˈbjuːtɪfəl/) in spring.

question: Amazed
questionMeaning: feeling or showing great wonder
answerMeaning: feeling shocked or amazed by something unexpected
sentence: I was surprised (/səˈpraɪzd/) by the birthday party.

question: Sugary
questionMeaning: containing a lot of sugar
answerMeaning: having a pleasant taste like sugar
sentence: The candy is very sweet (/swiːt/).

question: Lost
questionMeaning: unable to be found or recovered
answerMeaning: not able to be found or not present
sentence: My key is missing (/ˈmɪsɪŋ/).

question: Brave
questionMeaning: ready to face danger or pain
answerMeaning: having the ability to face fear or difficulty
sentence: The courageous (/kəˈreɪdʒəs/) firefighter saved the cat from the tree.

question: Mad
questionMeaning: upset or annoyed
answerMeaning: feeling strong emotions because of something bad
sentence: She is angry (/ˈæŋɡri/) because she lost her toy.

question: Bad
questionMeaning: not good
answerMeaning: very bad or unpleasant
sentence: The weather is terrible (/ˈtɛrɪbl/) today.

question: Opportunity
questionMeaning: a favourable time or situation for doing something
answerMeaning: the possibility of something happening
sentence: There's a good chance (/tʃɑːns/) it will rain tomorrow.

question: Technique
questionMeaning: a way of carrying out a particular task
answerMeaning: a way of doing something
sentence: She has an effective method (/ˈmɛθəd/) for studying.

question: Condition
questionMeaning: the state of something at a specific time
answerMeaning: a set of circumstances in which one finds oneself
sentence: The situation (/ˌsɪtʃuˈeɪʃən/) at work has improved.

question: Assistance
questionMeaning: help provided to someone
answerMeaning: help or assistance
sentence: I appreciate your support (/səˈpɔːt/) during tough times.

question: Assignment
questionMeaning: a specific job or duty assigned to someone
answerMeaning: a piece of work to be done
sentence: My task (/tɑːsk/) for today is to complete the report.

question: Care
questionMeaning: the process of providing for someone's needs
answerMeaning: the way in which someone or something is dealt with
sentence: He received excellent treatment (/ˈtriːtmənt/) at the hospital.

question: Worth
questionMeaning: the level at which something is valued
answerMeaning: the importance or worth of something
sentence: The value (/ˈvæljuː/) of honesty cannot be overstated.

question: Objective
questionMeaning: a specific result that a person aims to achieve
answerMeaning: the aim or desired result of an effort
sentence: His goal (/ɡəʊl/) is to finish the marathon.

question: Landmark
questionMeaning: a significant or historic building or site
answerMeaning: a place that draws visitors
sentence: The Eiffel Tower is a famous tourist attraction (/əˈtrækʃən/).

question: Success
questionMeaning: the accomplishment of a goal or purpose
answerMeaning: the accomplishment of a goal or purpose
sentence: Winning the award was a great achievement (/əˈtʃiːvmənt/) for her career.

question: Accomplish
questionMeaning: to successfully complete a task
answerMeaning: to reach a goal or target
sentence: She worked hard to achieve (/əˈtʃiːv/) her dreams.

question: Enhance
questionMeaning: to increase the quality of something
answerMeaning: to make something better
sentence: He wants to improve (/ɪmˈpruːv/) his English skills.

question: Clarify
questionMeaning: to make a statement less confusing
answerMeaning: to make something clear or easy to understand
sentence: The teacher explained (/ɪkˈspleɪnd/) the main idea of the story.

question: Reply
questionMeaning: to answer someone
answerMeaning: to reply or answer
sentence: She will respond (/rɪsˈpɒnd/) to your email shortly.

question: Avert
questionMeaning: to turn away or prevent something
answerMeaning: to stop something from happening
sentence: We must prevent (/prɪˈvɛnt/) accidents by being careful.

question: Oversee
questionMeaning: to supervise or direct
answerMeaning: to be in charge of or control something
sentence: She will manage (/ˈmæn.ɪdʒ/) the team effectively.

question: Produce
questionMeaning: to make or manufacture something
answerMeaning: to bring something into existence
sentence: He wants to create (/kriˈeɪt/) a new app.

question: Adhere
questionMeaning: to stick to something
answerMeaning: to come after or adhere to something
sentence: Please follow (/ˈfɒl.əʊ/) the instructions carefully.

question: Alter
questionMeaning: to modify or adjust something
answerMeaning: to make something different
sentence: You can change (/tʃeɪndʒ/) your mind at any time.

question: Aid
questionMeaning: to help or assist
answerMeaning: to provide help or assistance
sentence: We should support (/səˈpɔːt/) each other in our goals.

question: Alike
questionMeaning: having the same qualities
answerMeaning: having characteristics in common
sentence: The two paintings are very similar (/ˈsɪmɪlə/).

question: Frequent
questionMeaning: happening often
answerMeaning: occurring frequently or widely
sentence: This is a common (/ˈkɒmən/) problem among students.

question: Essential
questionMeaning: absolutely needed
answerMeaning: required or essential
sentence: It is necessary (/ˈnɛsəsəri/) to finish your homework.

question: Unexpected
questionMeaning: not expected or anticipated
answerMeaning: causing surprise; unexpected
sentence: The results of the test were surprising (/səˈpraɪzɪŋ/).

question: Appealing
questionMeaning: attractive or interesting
answerMeaning: pleasing or appealing to the senses
sentence: The design of the building is very attractive (/əˈtræktɪv/).

question: Truthful
questionMeaning: telling the truth
answerMeaning: truthful and sincere
sentence: It's important to be honest (/ˈɒnɪst/) with your friends.

question: Diverse
questionMeaning: showing a variety of different types
answerMeaning: different types or kinds
sentence: We have various (/ˈvɛəriəs/) options to choose from.

question: Significant
questionMeaning: having meaning or importance
answerMeaning: of great significance or value
sentence: Education is important (/ɪmˈpɔːtənt/) for everyone.

question: Challenging
questionMeaning: testing one's abilities
answerMeaning: hard to do or understand
sentence: The exam was difficult (/ˈdɪfɪkəlt/) for many students.

question: Imaginative
questionMeaning: having a lively and creative imagination
answerMeaning: having the ability to make new things or think in new ways
sentence: She has a creative (/kriˈeɪtɪv/) approach to problem-solving.

question: Paradox
questionMeaning: a statement that appears contradictory but may reveal a deeper truth
answerMeaning: a statement or proposition that seems self-contradictory or absurd but in reality expresses a possible truth
sentence: The dilemma (/dɪˈlɛm.ə/) of choosing between two equally appealing job offers was challenging.

question: Abyss
questionMeaning: a wide or profound difference between people
answerMeaning: a profound difference or gap between people or viewpoints
sentence: The chasm (/ˈkæz.əm/) between their beliefs made communication difficult.

question: Conundrum
questionMeaning: a confusing and difficult problem or question
answerMeaning: a person or thing that is mysterious or difficult to understand
sentence: The enigma (/ɪˈnɪɡ.mə/) of the missing manuscript intrigued historians for years.

question: Epitome
questionMeaning: a person or thing that is a perfect example of a particular quality
answerMeaning: the most perfect or typical example of a quality
sentence: She is the quintessence (/kwɪnˈtɛs.əns/) of elegance at every event she attends.

question: Anomaly
questionMeaning: something that deviates from what is standard or expected
answerMeaning: a departure from the normal or typical
sentence: The aberration (/ˌæbəˈreɪ.ʃən/) in the data raised serious concerns among the researchers.

question: Resilience
questionMeaning: the capacity to recover quickly from difficulties
answerMeaning: the ability to adjust to new conditions
sentence: Her adaptability (/əˌdæp.təˈbɪl.ɪ.ti/) in challenging situations impressed everyone.

question: Epiphany
questionMeaning: a moment of sudden and great revelation or insight
answerMeaning: the capacity to gain an accurate understanding
sentence: His insight (/ˈɪn.saɪt/) into human behaviour revolutionised his approach to leadership.

question: Convergence
questionMeaning: the process of coming together from different directions
answerMeaning: the act of joining together
sentence: The union (/ˈjuː.njən/) of diverse ideas resulted in a groundbreaking project.

question: Vicissitude
questionMeaning: a change of circumstances or fortune, often unwelcome
answerMeaning: an irregular rising and falling in number or amount
sentence: The fluctuation (/ˌflʌk.tʃuˈeɪ.ʃən/) in prices surprised many consumers.

question: Sanctuary
questionMeaning: a place of refuge or safety
answerMeaning: a place of safety or refuge
sentence: The library became a haven (/ˈheɪ.vən/) for students seeking peace and quiet.

question: Convey
questionMeaning: to communicate or make known
answerMeaning: to make information known or communicate
sentence: The mentor sought to impart (/ɪmˈpɑːt/) valuable life lessons to his students.

question: Exacerbate
questionMeaning: to make a problem or situation worse
answerMeaning: to intensify or worsen a situation
sentence: His rude comments only served to aggravate (/ˈæɡ.rə.veɪt/) the ongoing conflict.

question: Obfuscate
questionMeaning: to deliberately make something unclear or difficult to understand
answerMeaning: to confuse or perplex
sentence: The complicated instructions seemed designed to confound (/kənˈfaʊnd/) the users.

question: Acquiesce
questionMeaning: to accept something reluctantly but without protest
answerMeaning: to agree to something after careful consideration
sentence: After much debate, the committee finally consented (/kənˈsɛntɪd/) to the proposed changes.

question: Augment
questionMeaning: to make something greater by adding to it
answerMeaning: to increase or make something stronger
sentence: The team plans to amplify (/ˈæmplɪfaɪ/) their marketing efforts this quarter.

question: Inundate
questionMeaning: to overwhelm someone with things to deal with
answerMeaning: to overwhelm with a large quantity
sentence: The department was flooded (/ˈflʌd.ɪd/) with applications after the job advertisement.

question: Perpetuate
questionMeaning: to make something continue indefinitely
answerMeaning: to maintain or prolong something
sentence: The initiative aims to sustain (/səˈsteɪn/) cultural traditions for future generations.

question: Transcend
questionMeaning: to match or surpass a person or achievement by imitation
answerMeaning: to exceed or go beyond a limit
sentence: Her achievements managed to surpass (/səˈpɑːs/) all expectations.

question: Emulate
questionMeaning: to match or surpass a person or achievement by imitation
answerMeaning: to copy someone’s behaviour or actions
sentence: Young athletes often aspire to imitate (/ˈɪm.ɪ.teɪt/) the techniques of their idols.

question: Delineate
questionMeaning: to provide evidence to support or prove the truth of something
answerMeaning: to confirm or support the truth of something
sentence: The study aimed to validate (/ˈvæl.ɪ.deɪt/) the initial findings of previous research.

question: Ubiquitous
questionMeaning: present or existing everywhere
answerMeaning: found or existing everywhere
sentence: The omnipresent (/ˌɒmnɪˈprɛzənt/) influence of social media can be seen in every aspect of modern life.

question: Meticulous
questionMeaning: showing great attention to detail
answerMeaning: showing care and effort in one’s work
sentence: Her unyielding (/ʌnˈjiːldɪŋ/) stance on the issue made negotiations difficult.

question: Ambivalent
questionMeaning: having mixed feelings or contradictory ideas about something
answerMeaning: experiencing contradictory feelings or emotions
sentence: She felt conflicted (/kənˈflɪktɪd/) about accepting the promotion due to its demands.

question: Esoteric
questionMeaning: intended for or likely to be understood by only a small number of people
answerMeaning: understood by few; mysterious or secret
sentence: His arcane (/ɑːˈkeɪn/) knowledge of ancient texts fascinated the scholars.

question: Ineffable
questionMeaning: too great or extreme to be expressed in words
answerMeaning: unable to be expressed in words; beyond description
sentence: The indescribable (/ˌɪndɪsˈkraɪbəbəl/) beauty of the landscape took our breath away.

question: Ephemeral
questionMeaning: lasting for a very short time
answerMeaning: not permanent; temporary
sentence: The transitory (/ˈtrænzɪtəri/) nature of trends often makes them hard to follow.

question: Cacophonous
questionMeaning: involving a harsh, discordant mixture of sounds
answerMeaning: lacking harmony; harsh sounding
sentence: The dissonant (/ˈdɪsənənt/) sounds from the street distracted her while studying.

question: Salient
questionMeaning: most noticeable or important
answerMeaning: important; famous; standing out
sentence: The prominent (/ˈprɒmɪnənt/) features of the report were highlighted in the discussion.

question: Lugubrious
questionMeaning: lacking poetic beauty; commonplace; unromantic
answerMeaning: lacking interest or excitement; dull
sentence: His mundane (/mʌnˈdeɪn/) routine failed to inspire creativity.

question: Lucid
questionMeaning: expressed clearly; easy to understand
answerMeaning: easy to perceive or detect; clear
sentence: Her transparent (/trænsˈpɛərənt/) explanations made complex topics accessible to all.
